meanings.sent1: She decided to withdraw her hand from the cookie jar.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to withdraw their attention from the window.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to withdraw a rabbit from his hat, but it turned out to be a rubber duck.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows seemed to withdraw from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The detective carefully withdrew the evidence from the crime scene.

meanings.sent1: The soldier had to withdraw from the battlefield due to an injury.
meanings.sent2: During the argument, she chose to withdraw from the conversation to calm down.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to withdraw from the bath by climbing up the shower curtain.
meanings.sent4: The waves seemed to withdraw from the shore, leaving behind seashells.
meanings.sent5: The shy child would withdraw from social situations to feel more comfortable.

meanings.definition: To take money out of an account
meanings.sent1: He needed to withdraw some cash from the ATM for the weekend trip.
meanings.sent2: She decided to withdraw a portion of her savings to buy a new laptop.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was empty after the kids decided to withdraw all their coins.
meanings.sent4: The investor chose to withdraw his funds from the risky stock market.
meanings.sent5: The customer went to the bank to withdraw money for the concert tickets.
